Design Pattern - Observer (Dependents, PubSub)

Created:2018-03-07  Last modified:2018-03-07

  • Introduction
  • Implementation

  1. Introduction

    Observer : when one object changes state, all other objects are notifiedautomatically.

    Examples

    1. e.g. wether station object gather new temperature data, the LCD display should be notified, the data logger should be notified.
    2. e.g. A fire alarm object that detects smog should automatically call emergency and owner.

    Terms

    • Subject: the data model (data producer); Keep a list of observers; Define notify, call subject->update inside.
    • Observer: the data consumer, e.g. ask data to display; Provide a update() interface.
    • ConcreteSubject: the concrete subject class that inherits from the Subject;
    • ConcreteObserver: define the concrete update method.

      • * Subject and Observer should agree the data format. e.g. update(Data) the data structure.

  2. Implementation

    Consideration of the parameter of the update function.

    1. passing subject it self: 1). useful when the observer is listening mutlipe observer. 2). decouple abstract classes. 
          void update(Subject subject) {
        switch(subject->getTyep()) {
            case Weather:
            case Traffic:
            default:break;
        }
    }

    Where to trigger observer's Notify

    1. In the observer's setter method:
      -may have intermediate update that are not important => introduce overhead.
      - May cause violation of the self-consistent rule. (一致性 e.g. a + b === 10.)
      + sample
    2. Create a while loop [in other thread] to do the notify periodically or according its state.

    Granularity of the notification

    1. The subject class provides mutliple registry list. Each list for a different notification
    2. PubSub: notify according to topics.

    ChangeManage (Notification manager)

    As the mapping between observers and subjects becomes complex, a new class that is dedicated to achieve this notification job is requried.

    1. Change manager maps the observer and subject together. Register(Subject, Observer)
    2. Subject's notify will call the change manager's notification.

    Simple vs. DAG change manager. A observer subscribe multiple subjects. The mutliple subjects' change may cause the observer update redundant. And DAG prevent this from happening.
